Um, I think that the problem with live attenuated vaccines is again the balance because you don't want to have a too attenuated virus that doesn't replicate enough in the host and therefore doesn't elicit or stimulate the production of a particular threshold of antibodies or a immune response that is required to neutralize or control the infection. And you also don't want to have a attenuated virus that is not too attenuated that it will revert to wild type. So those are are I think critical issues with with the concept of that, but I like the idea of having a product like that so that um there are more diversity in the production of specific uh antiviral um antibodies.
